newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine stocks close firm on selective buying.
newsitem.headline: Argentine stocks close firm on selective buying.

text.p: Argentine stocks closed firm Wednesday on selective buying, though the U.S. Federal Reserve's decision to leave rates unchanged had been mainly discounted, dealers said.
The blue-chip MerVal index which has been finding resistance at 830 points and support at 800, was 0.69 percent higher at 824.11 by Wednesday's close.

"The market was selective with buying interest centered on local stocks with little weight on international markets," said Augusto Milou of Galicia Valores. "The lack of action by the Fed means dealers have got more freedom to maneuver now."
Volume was slimmer at 29.2 million pesos compared to 36.6 million in Tuesday's active session.
Trading in Telefonica de Argentina was hit by news that a federal judge fined the company backdated to March for failing to bill clients because of the row over a new tariff structure.

Telefonica's ADR fell half a percentage point early in the session but closed only 0.18 percent off. The stock in Buenos Aires closed a marginal 0.57 percent higher at 3.51 pesos, but was much more thinly traded than usual, dealers said.
